description.narrative: The DRC Humanitarian Assistance 2010 initiative supports various organisations to provide humanitarian assistance in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DCR). Funding under this initiative is allocated as follows: $3.5 million for United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) to provide protection to women and children in displaced persons camps in DRC. UNHCR is the lead agency in the prevention and protection of sexual violence and their operations assist in meeting the protection needs of women and children in the displaced persons camps in North and South Kivu; $2 million to the United Nations children's Fund (UNICEF) which will support displaced populations with child protection, water and sanitation, nutrition and emergency education services: and $3 million to the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) to support conflict-affected populations in the DRC. The total value of this initiative is $8.5 million expensed during the financial year 2009-10.
